section.name: Usage
section.p:
For those of you unfamiliar with configuring a plugin see the example below:
<project> <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion> <artifactId>my-test-app</artifactId> <groupId>my-test-group</groupId> <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
<build> <plugins>
<plugin> <artifactId>maven-antrun-plugin</artifactId> <executions> <execution> <phase>generate-sources</phase> <configuration> <tasks>
<!-- Place any ant task here. You can add anything you can add between <target> and </target> in a build.xml. -->
</tasks> </configuration> <goals> <goal>run</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> </plugin>
</plugins> </build> </project>
The example above illustrates how to bind an ant script to a lifecycle phase. You can add a script to each lifecycle phase, by duplicating the <execution/> section and specifying a new phase.
